text: The slope of the straight line displacement-time graph indicates?
explanation:
\(\frac{\bigtriangleup s}{\bigtriangleup t}\) = uniform velocity
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: A man will exert the greatest pressure when he?

options.D: stands on the toes of one foot

explanation:
Pressure varies inversely as A
i.e P \(\propto\) \(\frac{1}{A}\)
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Which of the units of the following physical quantities are derived?
I. Area
II. Thrust
III. Pressure
IV. Mass
explanation:
Only 'mass' is a fundamental quantity
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: A ball of mass 0.5kg moving at 10ms\(^{-1}\) collides with another ball of equal mass at rest. If the two balls move off together after the impact, calculate their common velocity.
The motion of a body is simple harmonic if the?

options.A: acceleration is always directed towards a fixed point
options.B: path of motion is a straight line
options.C: acceleration is proportional to the square of the distance from a fixed point
options.D: acceleration is constant and directed towards a fixed point

explanation:
In simple harmonic motion, the acceleration of the particle is directed towards its mean position and directly proportional to its displacement.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Which of the following is not correct about the molecules of a substance in a gaseous state. They?

options.A: are in a constant state of motion
options.C: have a temperature which is measured by the average kinetic energy
options.D: The collision between the gases is perfectly inelastic

explanation:
The collision between the gases is perfectly elastic
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: A given mass of gas has a pressure of 80 Nm\(^{-2}\) at a temperature of 47 C. If the temperature is reduced to 27 C with volume remaining constant, the new pressure is?

0.5kg of water at 10ºC is completely converted to ice at 0ºC by extracting (88000) of heat from it. If the specific heat capacity of water is 4200jkg\(^{1}\) Cº. Calculate the specific latent heat of fusion of ice.
explanation:
Heat involved (H) = 88,000J, Mass(M)= 0.5kg,  specific heat capacity of water(C) = 4200JkgºC,
Specific latent heat of fusion(L) = ?, Temperature change(Δθ) =  θ2 -  θ1 =  (10 - 0)° = 10°
H = MCΔθ + ML
or
H = M(CΔθ + L) -->\(\frac{H}{M}\) = CΔθ + L
: L = \(\frac{H}{M}\) -  CΔθ = \(\frac{88,000}{0.5}\) - 4200 \(\times\) 10
L = 176,000 - 42000 = 134,000
L = 134,000 or 134kj/kg
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Which of the following instruments may be used to measure relative humidity?
explanation:
A hygrometer is an instrument that is used to measure water vapor in the atmosphere. This is also commonly referred to asrelative humidityin the atmosphere.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: A source of sound produces waves in air of wavelength 1.65m. If the speed of sound in air is 330ms\(^{-1}\), the period of vibration in air is?
explanation:
V = \(\frac{\lambda}{T}\)
: v = 330ms\(^{-1}\)\(\lambda\) = 1.65mT = ?
330 = 1.65
T = \(\frac{1.65}{330}\) = 0.005s
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: A boy standing some distance from the foot of a tall cliff claps his hands and hears an echo 0.5s later. If the speed of sound is 340ms\(^{-1}\), how far is he from the cliff?
explanation:
V = \(\frac{2d}{t}\)v = 340ms\(^{-1}\)t = 0.5sd= ?
d = \(\frac{2d}{2} = \frac{340 \times 0.5}{2}\) = 85m
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Which of the following is not a vector quantity?
explanation:
,displacement, velocity, and acceleration, linear momentum, forceare vector quantities, while speed (the magnitude of velocity), time, and mass are scalars. To qualify as a vector, a quantity having magnitude and direction must also obey certain rules of combination.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Calculate the heat energy required to vaporize 50g of water initially at 80ºC if the specific heat capacity of water is 4.23jg\(^{-1}\)k\(^{-1}\) (specific latent heat of vaporization of water is 2260jg\(^{-1}\)
explanation:
H = mc\(\bigtriangleup\theta\) + mL
H = ?
m = 50g, c = 4.23J/gk,L = 2260, \(\bigtriangleup\theta\) = 80ºC
H = 50 [4.23 x 80 + 2260]
= 129920 \(\approx\) 130,000J
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: In a series R-L-C circuit at resonance, the voltages across the resistor and the inductors are 30V and 40V respectively. What is the voltage across the capacitor?
explanation:
AT resonance; X\(_{L}\) = X\(_{c}\)
\(\therefore\) = V\(_{L}\) = V\(_{c}\) = 40V
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
If the frequency of an emitted x-ray is 1.6 x 10\(^{16}\)Hz, the accelerating potential is?
 [e = 1.6 x 10\(^{-19}\)J, h = 6.63 x 10-\(^{34}\)Js]
explanation:
Given f = 1.6 x10\(^{16}\)H\(_{3}\), h = 6.63 x 10\(^{-39}\)Js
e = 1.6 x 10\(^{-19}\)C, V = ?
V = \(\frac{w}{e} = \frac{hf}{e}\) = \(\frac{1.6 \times 10^{16} \times 6.63 \times 10^{34}}{1.6 \times 10^{-19}}\)
= 66.3V
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: If the fraction of the atoms of a radioactive material left after 120 years is 1/64, what is the half-life of the material?
explanation:
Given amount remaining = \(\frac{1}{64}\)
= \(\frac{1}{64} = \frac{1}{(2)^{6}}\)
\(\therefore\) = \(\frac{120 \text {years}}{6}\) = 20 years
\(\Rightarrow\) T\(\frac{1}{2}\) = 20 years
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: A certain radioactive source emits radiation that was found to be deflected by both magnetic and electric fields. The radiation is?
explanation:
Both the electric field and magnetic field affect the β-particles.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The inner diameter of a test tube can be measured accurately using a?
explanation:
Vernier calipers are also used to measure the internal and external diameters of a tube
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Two bodies have masses in the ratio3:1. They experience forces which impart to them, acceleration in the ratio 2:9 respectively. Find the ratio of forces the masses experienced
explanation:
Given \(\frac{m_{1}}{m_{2}} = \frac{3}{1}\) \(\Rightarrow\) m\(_{1}\) = 3m\(_{2}\)
\(\frac{a_{1}}{a_{2}} = \frac{2}{9}\) = a\(_{1}\) = \(\frac{2a_{2}}{9}\)
\(\frac{F_{1}}{F_{2}}\) = ?
Since F = ma
\(\Rightarrow\)  \(\frac{F_{1}}{F_{2}} = \frac{m_{1}a_{1}}{m_{2}a_{2}}\) = \(\frac{(3 \not m_{2})(2 \not a_{2})}{\not m_{2} a_{2} \not a_{3}}\)
\(\frac{F_{1}}{F_{2}} = \frac{2}{3}\) \(\Rightarrow\) 2:3
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Particles of mass 10\(^{-2}\)kg is fixed to the tip of a fan blade which rotates with angular velocity of 100rad\(^{-1}\). If the radius of the blade is 0.2m, the centripetal force is?
explanation:
Givenm = 10\(^{-2}\)w = 100rads\(^{-1}\)F = mw\(^{2}\)rr = 0.2mF = ?
= 10\(^{-2}\) x (100)\(^{2}\) x 0.2
= 20N
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: A lead bullet of mass 0.05kg is fired with a velocity of 200ms\(^{-1}\) into a block of mass 0.95kg. Given that the lead block can move freely, the final kinetic energy after impact is?

A ball of mass 0.1kg is thrown vertically upwards with a speed of 10ms\(^{-1}\) from the top of a tower 10m high. Neglecting air resistance, its total energy just before hitting the ground is? (Take g = 10ms\(^{-2}\))
explanation:
Givnm = 0.1kgu = 10ms\(^{-1}\)h = 10mg = 10ms\(^{-2}\)
At h\(_{max}\); v = 0
Using\(
ot v\) = \(
ot u\) = \(
ot gt\)\(
ot 0\) = \(
ot w\) - \(
ot 10t\)
v\(^{2}\) = u\(^{2}\) - 2gh0\(^{2}\) = 10\(^{2}\) - 2 x 10h20h = 100h = 5mTotal height = 10 + 5= 15mTotal energy = mghr = 0.1 x 10 x1 5= 15J
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: A car of mass 800kg attains a speed of 25m/s in 20secs. The power developed in the engine is?
explanation:
P = \(\frac{mv^{2}}{t} = \frac{800 \times 25 \times 25}{20}\)
2.5 x 10\(^{4}\)W
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: When the breaks in a car are applied, the frictional force on the tyres is?

options.A: a disadvantage because it is in the direction of the motion of the car
options.B: a disadvantage because it is in the opposite direction of the motion of the car
options.C: an advantage because it is in the direction of the motion of the car
options.D: an advantage because it is in the opposite direction of the motion of the car

explanation:
Frictional force opposes motion
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: If the stress on a wire is 10\(^{7}\)NM\(^{-2}\) and the wire is stretched from its original length of 10.00m to 10.05m. The young's modulus of the wire is?
explanation:
Young's modulus \(\frac{stress}{strain}\)
Strain = \(\frac{e}{l} = \frac{0.05}{10} = \frac{10^{7}}{0.005}\)
2 x 10\(^{9}\)Nm\(^{-2}\)
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: A solid weighs 10.00N in air, 6N when forcefully immersed in water, and 7.0N when fully immersed in a liquid, X. Calculate the relative density of the liquid X.
explanation:
R.D = \(\frac{\text {weigh in air - weigh in liquid X}}{\text {weigh in air - weigh in water}}\)
= \(\frac{10 - 7}{10 - 6} = \frac{3}{4}\)
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: When the temperature of a liquid increases, its surface tension
explanation:
Surface tension decreases by:
* Increasing liquid's temperature
* Adding soap to the liquid
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: A gas at a volume of V\(_{0}\) in a container at pressure p\(_{0}\) is compressed to one-fifth of its volume. What will be its pressure if the magnitude of its original temperature T is constant?

A piece of substance of specific heat capacity 450Jkg\(^{-1}\)k\(^{1}\) falls through a vertical distance of 20m from rest. Calculate the rise in temperature of the substance on hitting the ground when all its energies are converted into heat. [g = 10ms\(^{-2}\)]
explanation:
Using the law of conservation of energy
mc\(\bigtriangleup\theta\) = mgh
\(\bigtriangleup\theta\) = \(\frac{gh}{c} = \frac{10 \times 20}{450} = \frac{4}{9}\)ºC
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
I. A liquid boils when its saturated vapor pressure is equal to the external pressure
II. Dissolved substances in pure water lead to an increase in the boiling point.
III. When the external pressure is increased, the boiling point increases.
IV. Dissolved substances in pure water decreases the boiling point 
Which of the above combinations are peculiarities of the boiling point of a liquid?
explanation:
The boiling point of a liquid depends on temperature, atmospheric pressure, and the vapor pressure of the liquid.When the atmospheric pressure is equal to the vapor pressure of the liquid, boiling will begin
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The temperature gradient across a copper rod of thickness 0.02m, maintained at two temperature junctions of 20º and 80ºC respectively is?
explanation:
\(\Delta\) = \(\frac{\bigtriangleup\theta}{\delta} = \frac{80-20}{0.02}\)
= 3.0 x 10\(^{3}\)km\(^{-1}\)
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Calculate the mass of ice that would melt when 2kg of copper is quickly transferred from boiling water to a block of ice without heat loss (specific heat capacity of copper = 400Jkg\(^{1}\)k\(^{-1}\), latent heat of fusion of ice = 3.3 x 10\(^{5}\)Jkg\(^{-1}\))
explanation:
mc\(\Delta\theta\) = m\(\lambda\)f
2 x 400 (100 - 0) = m(3.3 x 10\(^{5}\))
m = \(\frac{2 \times 400 \times 100}{3.3 \times 10^{5}} = \frac{8}{33}\)kg
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The equation of a wave traveling along the positive x-direction is given by; y = 0.25 x 10\(^{-3}\) sin (500t - 0.025x). Determine the angular velocity of the wave motion.
explanation:
Using y = A sin (wt + 0)
Given y = 0.25 x 10\(^{-3}\)sin (500t - 0.025x)
By comparing, w = 5.00 x 10\(^{2}\)rads\(^{-1}\)
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: If a sound wave goes from a cold air region to a hot air region, its wavelength will?
explanation:
click here
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The lowest note emitted by a stretched string has a frequency of 40Hz. How many overtones are there between 40Hz and 180Hz?
explanation:
f\(_{0}\) = 40H\(_{3}\)
1st overtone = 2f\(_{0}\) = 80H\(_{3}\)
2nd overtone = 3f\(_{0}\) = 120H\(_{3}\)
3rd overtone = 4f\(_{0}\) = 160H\(_{3}\)
4th overtone = 5f\(_{0}\) = 200H\(_{3}\)
\(\therefore\) Number of overtones between 40H\(_{3}\) and 180H\(_{3}\) = 3
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: A man stands 4m in front of a plane mirror. If the mirror is moved 1m towards the man, the distance between him and his new image is?
explanation:
Objects distance (u) = image distance (v)
object distance = 3m
|uv| = 3 + 3 = 6m
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The inside portion of part of a hollow metal sphere of diameter 20cm is polished. The portion will therefore form a?
explanation:
Concave Mirror: It is a spherical mirror whoseouter surface is polished and inner or concave side is reflecting surface.
Convex Mirror: It is a spherical mirror whose inner surface is polished and whose outer side or convex side is the reflecting surface.
f = \(\frac{m}{4}\) = f = \(\frac{d}{4}\)
f = \(\frac{20}{4}\) = 5cm
(For metal, it is the polished side that will be the reflecting surface)
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The velocities of light in air and glass are 3.0 x 10\(^8\)ms\(^{-1}\) and 2.0 x 10\(^8\)ms\(^{-1}\) respectively. If the angle of refraction is 30º, the sine of the angle of incidence is?
explanation:
\(\frac{\text {sin i}}{\text {sin r}}\) = \(\frac{\text {velocity in air}}{\text {velocity in glass}}\)
\(\frac{\text {sin i}}{\text {sin 30}}\) = \(\frac{3 \times 10^{8}}{2 \times 10^{8}}\)
Sin i = \(\frac{3}{4}\) = 0.75
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: An astronomical telescope is said to be in normal adjustment when the?

options.B: focal length of an object lens is longer than that of eye piece
options.C: final image is at the near point of eye

explanation:
A normal arrangement is an arrangement where the principal focus of objective coincides with the eyepiece so that the final image is at infinity
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: A 2H inductor has negligible resistance and is connected to a \(\frac{50}{\pi}\) Hz A.C supply. The reactance of the inductor is?
explanation:
Given;
L = 2HF = \(\frac{50}{\pi}\) H\(_{2}\)X\(_{L}\) = ?
X\(_{L}\) = 2\(\pi\)fL = 2\(\pi\) x \(\frac{50}{\lambda}\) x 2
= 200\(\Omega\)
There is an explanation video availablebelow.
